docs.lead_paragraph: PRACTICE AND PLEADING UNDER THE CODE; WITH AN APPENDIX OF FORMS AND TEXT OF CODE AND RULES, By HENRY WHITTAKER. Second Edition, Two volumes. For sale by JOHN J. DROSSY. EVERY lawyer knows "Whittaker's Practice," in one volume, and knowing it, will be glad to know of "Whittaker's Practice," in tow volumes.

docs.lead_paragraph: In London there are a great many "receiving-houses," or places at which letters and newspapers may be posted, for transmission through the general or town post-office. These "receiving-houses" are attended with considerable expense, for a certain rent is annually paid for their use, out of the Post-Office revenue.

headline.main: MEAGHER REPUBLICAN GRENADIERS.; SPEECH OF JOHN MITCHEL. Annual Ball in the Hudson House, Jersey City.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Annual Ball of the Meagher Republican Grenadiers took place last night in the Hudson House, Jersey City, under circumstances which lent to the occasion a more than ordinary interest.
docs.snippet: The Annual Ball of the Meagher Republican Grenadiers took place last night in the Hudson House, Jersey City, under circumstances which lent to the occasion a more than ordinary interest.

headline.main: POLITICAL INTELLIGENCE.; State Convention of the Silver Grays.

docs.lead_paragraph: In view of the new issues of the present canvass, and the perplexities they present, a number of the prominent conservative politicians of this State assembled early last week, to talk over matters, and decide upon the course that should be pursued.
docs.abstract: Address to the people of N.Y
docs.snippet: In view of the new issues of the present canvass, and the perplexities they present, a number of the prominent conservative politicians of this State assembled early last week, to talk over matters, and decide upon the course that should be pursued.

headline.main: ECCLESIASTICAL.; PASTORAL LETTER. The Roman Catholic Church in the State of New-York.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Archbishop and Bishops of the Province of New-York, assembled in the Metropolitan Church of New-York, to the venerable Clergy and beloved Larty of their charge--health and benediction. VENERABLE HRETHREN OF THE CLERGY, AND BELOVED CHILDREN OF THE LAITY: The objects for the attainment of which we have been assembled in Provincial Council are now accomplished, so far as depends upon us.
docs.abstract: First Council at NY. - Its pastural letter

headline.main: Etiquette versus Humanity--The Wounded on the Battle-field.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the WELLINGTON dispatches are frequent complaints of the indifferent manner in which, during the Peninsular War of 1808-14, the British Government provided surgical assistance for the troops who were engaged in contest with the forces of NAPOLEON.
